meanings.sent1: The children holloed with joy when they saw the ice cream truck.
meanings.sent2: He holloed for help when he got lost in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The fans holloed so loudly at the concert that they could be heard from miles away.
meanings.sent4: Her voice holloed through the empty hallways, echoing off the walls.
meanings.sent5: The coach holloed instructions to the players on the field, guiding them to victory.

meanings.sent1: The holloed tree stump made a perfect hiding spot for the squirrel.
meanings.sent2: She found a holloed log to use as a makeshift drum in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The holloed pumpkin served as a unique vase for the flowers.
meanings.sent4: The holloed-out cave provided shelter for the weary travelers.
meanings.sent5: The holloed tree trunk was home to a family of owls.

meanings.definition: Made a loud noise or cry
meanings.sent1: The thunder holloed in the distance, signaling an approaching storm.
meanings.sent2: The baby holloed in the middle of the night, waking up the entire household.
meanings.sent3: The cat holloed at the top of the tree until the firefighters rescued it.
meanings.sent4: The wind holloed through the trees, creating an eerie sound in the forest.
meanings.sent5: The wolf holloed at the moon, its cry echoing across the night sky.
